conclusion: Understanding how the position and size of shadows change when the light source moves to the front right.
The light source is currently positioned above the objects, casting shadows A, B, C, and D on the ground.
A is cast by the object on the left.
B is cast by the small object.
C is cast by the large object.
D is cast by the paper airplane.
The light source moves to the front right, positioned to the front and slightly to the right of the objects.
Shadow A will be shorter and more to the right and front of the object.
Shadow B will be shorter and more to the right and front of the small object.
Shadow C will be shorter and more to the right and front of the large object.
Shadow D will be shorter and more to the right and front of the paper airplane.
All shadows will be shorter and more to the right and front of their respective objects.
The sizes of the shadows will remain approximately the same.
Final answer: A, B, C, and D will all be shorter and more to the right and front of their respective objects. The sizes of the shadows will remain approximately the same.
